intro: Mosannona garwoodiae, commonly known as the Garwood's mosannona, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Guatemala and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
